head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 3 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Palladius and Jerome. Lives and Anecdotes of Ascetics, taken chiefly from the works ofPalladiusandHieronymus. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Palladius and Jerome
msItem.title: Lives and Anecdotes of Ascetics, taken chiefly from the works ofPalladiusandHieronymus

msItem.author: Palladius of Aspuna
msItem.title: Life ofPachomius
msItem.incipit: ܣܦܩܐܝܬ ܐܝܟ ܕܣ̇ܒܪ ܐܢܐ̇. ܡܨ̈ܝܢ ܠܡܥܕܪܘ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܟܬܒ. ܗ̇ܝ ܗܟܝܠ ܕܠܘܬܗܝܢ ܟܕ ܠܘܬܗܝܢ ܢܪܗܛ. ܙܗܝܪܐ ܛܒ ܡܥܒܕܐ ܠܗ ܠܫܡܘܥܐ̇. ܠܘܬ ܬܐܘܪܝܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܐܡܪ̈ܢ. ܗ̇ܝ ܕܝܢ ܕܡܛܠ ܡܐܝܢܘܬܐ ܢܫܬܐܠ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܗܠܝـ̣ܢ. ܩܝܢܕܘܢܘܣ ܡܝܬܐ ܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܫܬ̇ܐܠ. ܒܕܓܘܢ̣. ܟܕ ܡܢ ܕܪܫ ܪܗܛܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܒܡܠܬܐ̣. ܐܚܝ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܩܠܝܠ ܕܗܠܝܢ ܩܕܡ̈ܝܬܐ ܐܡܪܝܢ ܚܢܢ܀ ܥܝܕܐ ܐܝܬ ܗܘܐ ܠܐ̈ܚܐ̣. ܕܪܚ̇ܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܒܘܢ ܦܟܘܡ̣. ܒܟܘܠ ܪܡܫܐ ܒܕܘܟܬܐ ܡܬܚܡܬܐ̇. ܒܕܝܪܐ ܠܡܬܟܢܫܘܼ. ܡܛܠ ܕܢܫܡܥܘܢ ܡܠܦܢܘܬܗ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Life ofMalchus, the captive monk, byHieronymus
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܡܛܠ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܫܒܝܐ ܕܫܡܗ ܡܠܟܐ.
msItem.note: Instead ofNisibeni agelli colonus, at the beginning of cap. ii., the Syriac has:ܐܢܐ ܐܬ̇ܝܠܕܬ ܒܩܪܝܬܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܐ ܚܣܝܒܢܐ.

msItem.author: Palladius of Aspuna
msItem.title: A passage found in some copies of the Paradise, after the account ofJohn ofLycos
msItem.rubric: ܠܗܢܐ ܕܘܒܪܐ ܪܬܚ̇ܐ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܐܚܪܢܐ ܐܫ̇ܟܚܬܐ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܘܒܪܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܚܒܝܫܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܠܘܩܘܣ.

msItem.author: Palladius of Aspuna
msItem.title: Life ofJacobthe wandering monk
msItem.note:
After a short introduction, we read as follows,fol. 37 b:ܗܘ̣ܐ ܐܢܫ ܡܫܢܝܢܐ ܒܩܘܪܝܬ ܡܕܝܢܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܝܐ ܗܘܬ
ܦܪܦܘܪܐܘܢ Porphyreon in Phoenicia
. ܕܫܡܗ ܗܘܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ. ܗܢܐ ܟܕ ܦܪܫ ܢܦܫܗ ܡܢ ܣܕܝܩܘܬܗ ܕܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ. ܥܡ̣ܪ ܒܡܥܪܬܐ ܚܕܐ ܚܡܫܥܣܪܐ ܫ̈ܢܝܢ. ܗܢܐ ܟܠܗ ܒܡܝܬܪܘܬܐ ܘܒܥܢܘܝܘܬܐ ܐܬܪܒܝ. ܐܝܟܢܐ ܕܡܝܩܪܐ ܘܡܝܬܪܐ ܢܬܚܘܐ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܘܢܫܬܘܐ ܠܡܘܗܒܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܫܐ̈ܕܐ. ܘܕܐܣ̈ܘܬܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܣܓ̈ܝܐܬܐ. ܒܫܡܗ ܕܦܪܘܩܢ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܢܫܡܠܐ. ܟܠܢܫ ܗܟܝܠ ܟܕ ܡܬܕܡܪ ܗܘܐ ܒܕܘܒܪܗ ܕܓܒܪܐ ܠܘܬܗ ܪܗܛܝܢ ܗܘܘ. ܕܣܘܓܐܗܘܢ ܡܢ ܕܚܠܬܐ ܕܫܡܪ̈ܝܐ ܪ̈ܫܝܥܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܗܘܘ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8in. by 6, consisting of 48 leaves. The quires, 5 in number, are now signed with letters. Each page has from 28 to 31 lines. The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the viithor viiithcent., except on fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves), which is of the xiith cent

collation.p: The quires, 5 in number, are now signed with letters.

layout.p: Each page has from 28 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of theviith or viiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: Fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves) is of thexiith cent.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩ̈ܛܐ. ܕܩܢܘܗܝ ܡܢ ܡܕܡ ܕܙܢܬ ܐܢܘܢ ܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܡܬܝ ܘܐܒܪܗܡ ܘܬܐܝܕܪܐ ܘܝܘܣܦ ܬܓܪ̈ܝܬܢܝܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ. ܘܟܠܡܢ ܕܠܚܐ ܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ. ܢܬܠ̣ܚܐ ܫܡܗ ܡܢ ܣܦܪܐ ܕܚ̈ܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ..

item.p: These linesare written over a more ancient note, of which only the concluding words are left,

p.quote: ܒܦܣܩܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܘܐܢ ܡܡܪܚ ܒܗ ܒܦܣܩܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ.

item.p: A few words lower down inform us that the book was repaired and bound by oneEphraim

p.quote: ܨܒܬ ܘܕܒܩ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܐܡܝܢ܀.

item.p: On fol. 1a there is a later note, repeating the statement that the manuscript belonged to theconvent of S. Mary Deipara; and under it are the letters G. PP.

accMat.p: Fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves) is of thexiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.title: Short extract
msItem.incipit: ܐܢ ܒܨܘܡܐ ܫ̇ܪܝܬ݂ ܦܓܕ ܠܫܢܟ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒ̇ܥܐ ܝܕܥܬܐ̣. ܢܬܪܘܨ ܝܬܗ ܕܠܐ ܚ̈ܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Extract

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Of the Seraphim
msItem.incipit: ܣܪ̈ܦܐ ܕܫܬܐ ܓܦܝ̈ܗܘܢ̣ ܩܢܘ̈ܡܐ ܡ̈ܠܝܠܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Of the Cherubim
msItem.incipit: ܟܪ̈ܘܒܐ ܣ̈ܓܝܐܝ ܥܝ̈ܢܐ ܩܢܘ̈ܡܐ ܡ̈ܠܝܠܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܕܒܚܬܐ ܕܟܝܬܐ ܐܝܬܝܗ̣̇. ܬܐܪܬܐ ܕܟܝܬܐ ܘܠܐ ܒܨܘܝܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܥܩܪܐ ܕܡܫܝ̈ܓܢܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ̣. ܬܘܬ ܢܦܫܐ ܚܡܝܡܬܐ̇ ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܐܝܩܛܪܘܣ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ̣. ܬܐܪܬܐ ܢܣܝܣܬܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ̇ ܒܕܟܪܝܗܐܝܬ ܚܝܪܐ ܒܐܠܗܐ ܘܒܬܐܘܪܝܐ ܕܥܒ̈ܝܕܐ.

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Sayings of the disciples of Evagrius
msItem.incipit: ܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ ܠܐܝ̈ܠܝܢ ܕܡܫ̣ܠܡܝܢ ܡܠܬܐ̣ ܚܡܫܐ ܗܘ ܒܫܒܐ. ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܝܢ ܕܡܛܝܒܝܢ ܢܦܫܗܘܢ ܠܘܬ ܐܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܬܝܕ݂ ܥܪܘܒܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Letters ofEvagriustoMelania

msItem.author: Ignatius
msItem.title: Letter ofIgnatiustoPolycarpofSmyrna

listBibl.bibl: Cureton's Corpus Ignatianum, p. xxix. and p. 2.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 5/8, consisting of 32 leaves (Add. 12,175, foll. 49—80), some of which are slightly stained by water. The quires, three in number, are now signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 47 to 56 lines. This manuscript is written in a small, neat character of the vith cent., perhaps by the same scribe as foll. 81—254 (see no. DCCXXVII.), in which case its date is A.D. 534.

collation.p: The quires, three in number, are now signed with letters

item.p: Some of the leaves are slightly stained by water

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 47 to 56 lines.

handNote.desc:
This manuscript is written in a small, neat character of thevith cent., perhaps by the same scribe as foll.81-254(see
no. DCCXXVII
.), in which case its date isA.D. 534.

item.p: On fol. 80b a reader calledBar-saumahas recorded his name:

p.quote: ܐܢܐ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ ܕܩܪܝܬ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Evagrius
msItem.title: Works of Evagrius

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: The Six Centuries
msItem.finalRubric: ܫ̣ܠܡ ܡܐܘ̈ܬܐ ܫܬ ܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ̈ܝܢ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ.

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Concerning the things that happen in dreams
msItem.incipit: ܐܡܬܝ ܕܒܫܪ̈ܓܪܓܝܬܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܒܡܢܬܐ ܕܪܓܬܐ ܡܩܪܒܝܢ ܥܡܢ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ̣. ܏ܘܫ

listBibl.bibl: Compare Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. vii., p. 563.

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Asceticon, dedicated toAnatolius
msItem.rubric: ܟܬܒܐ ܐܣܩܝܛܝܩܘܢ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ
msItem.note:
The introduction,fol. 101 a, is identical with that prefixed to the Capita practica inGallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. vii., p. 553; but the treatise is that which, in
Add. 14,578, (no. 4, fol. 34 b)
, is entitled
ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܕܥܠ ܬܡܢܝܐ ܚ̈ܘܫܒܝܢ discourse on the eight evil thoughts
. Here the title is,fol. 101b, 2nd col.,
ܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓܡܐ ܡܢ ܟ̈ܬܒܝ ܩܘܕܫܐ. ܠܘܩܒܠ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ ܕܡܢܣܝܢ ܠܢ. answers from the Holy Scriptures to the demons that tempt us
.

msItem.author: Basil
msItem.title: Life ofEvagrius, ascribed toBasil
msItem.rubric: ܢܨܚܢܐ ܕܥܒܝܕ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ ܥܠ ܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܫܪܝ ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܫܠܡ ܪܗܛܗ ܕܒܥܠܡܐ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܕܥܬܐ. ܘܥܠ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܚ̈ܠܡܐ ܓܕܫܢ. ܘܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܐܣܩܝܛܝܩܘܢ. ܘܩܘܠܣܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ.
msItem.note: It is, however, almost identical with the account ofEvagriusbyPalladius, as given inBosweyde's Vitae Patrum, p. 763, or inMigne, Patrologiae Cursus Completus, Series Lat., t. lxxiii., col. 1182;Migne, Patrologiae Cursus Completus, Series Gr., t. xxxiv., col. 1188

msItem.author: Evagrius of Pontus
msItem.title: Tract entitled,on thoughts of every kind, in 26 sections
msItem.note:
It corresponds with the treatise de diversis malignis cogitationibus inNili Opera, ed. Suaresius, p. 512.
See Add. 14,578, no. 6
.

incipit.sic: ܡܢ ܩܕܡܝ ܟܠ ܡܕܡ ܣܢܝܩܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܥܠ ܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ ܒܟܠ ܡܕܡ̣. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.author: Palladius
Hieronymus
msItem.title: To those who dwell with one another
msItem.incipit: ܐܢ ܥܠ̣ܬ ܕܬܥܡܪ ܥܡ ܐܚ̈ܐ̣. ܛܪ ܢܦܫܟ ܕܠܐ ܬܣܒ ܦܪܗܣܝܐ̣. ܘܡܫ̇ܠܡ ܐܢܬ ܥܘܡܪܟ݂ ܒܫܠܡܐ..
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܬܫ̈ܥܝܬܐ ܕܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܐܚ̈ܐ ܝܚܝ̈ܕܝܐ ܕܗܘܘ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ..

msItem.author: Palladius
Hieronymus
msItem.title: Sayings ofAbbā Poemen

msItem.author: Palladius
Hieronymus
msItem.title: Sayings ofAbbā Moses
msItem.rubric: ܗܠܝܢ ܫܒ̈ܥ ܡ̈ܠܝܢ ܕܟܬ݂ܒ ܐܒܐ ܡܘܫܐ ܠܐܒܐ ܦܘܝܡܢ. ܕܟܠ ܕܢܛ̇ܪ ܠܗܝܢ ܡܫܟܚ ܡܬܦܪܩ ܡܢ ܓܗܢܐ. ܘܡܬܬܢܝ̣ܚ ܟܠ ܐܝܟܐ ܕܨܒ̇ܐ ܕܢܥܡܪ. ܐܢ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܘܐܢ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܘܐܢ ܒܝܬ ܒ̈ܢܝܢܫܐ.

msItem.author: Palladius
Hieronymus
msItem.title: Anecdotes of the Fathers in theThebaid

msItem.author: Macarius the Great
msItem.title: Writings ofMacarius the Great, or the Egyptian

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Hortatory address to those wishing to become ascetics
msItem.rubric: ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܡܩܪܝܣ ܠܘܬ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܝܢ ܠܬܘܠܡܕܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܐܦ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܐ̈ܚܐ ܪ̈ܚܝ̇ܡܐ ܘܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ: ܙܒܢ̈ܬܐ ܣܓܝܐ̈ܬܐ ܒܝܕ ܪܬܚܐ ܕܚܘܒܟܘܢ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܠܗܐ܆ ܫܐܠܬܘܢ ܡܢ ܒܨܝܪܘܬܝ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ: ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: On the inward passions of the soul
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚ̈ܫܐ ܓܘ̈ܝܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ ܟܘܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܫܪܪܐ ܡܢ ܟܘܠܗ ܠܒܗ ܨܒ̇ܐ ܠܡܫܦܪ ܠܐܠܗܐ̣. ܠܐ ܙܕܩ̇ ܠܗ ܕܒܐܝܩܪܐ ܢܦܫܗ ܢܐܚܘܕ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.incipit: ܠܘܬ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܩܪܒܝܢ ܠܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Address to those who draw nigh to the path of truth
msItem.incipit: ܟܘܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܗܟܝܠ ܕܨܒ̇ܐ ܠܡܬܩܪܒܘ ܠܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ: ܕܗ̣ܝ ܡܫܟܚܐ ܡܩܪܒܐ ܠܘܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܪܕܝܢ ܒܗ̇ ܬܩܢܐܝܬ ܐܝܟ ܨܒܝܢܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ̣. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: On repentance
msItem.incipit: ܢܬܘܒ ܐܚ̈ܝ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܗܐ ܓܝܪ ܒܕܡܘܬ ܥܪܦܠܐ ܚܡܬܐ ܦܪܝܣܐ ܥܠ ܗܘܢܢ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Letters of Macarius, eight in number

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܐܒܐ ܡܩܪܝܣ ܟܬܒ ܠܟܘܠܗܘܢ ܒܢ̈ܘܗܝ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܟܕ ܡܦܝܣ ܠܗܘܢ ܘܫܐ̇ܠ ܒܫܠܡܗܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܒ̈ܢܝܐ ܪ̈ܚܝܡܐ ܡܘ̇ܕܐ ܐܢܐ ܬܘܒ ܠܐܠܗܐ̣. ܕܐܫܟܚܬ ܦܫܝܩܘܬܐ. ܕܒܝܕ ܟܬܝܒ̈ܬܐ ܐܥܗܕܟܘܢ̣. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܐ ܐܢܫ ܡܫܟܚ ܕܠܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܪ̈ܘܢ ܢܦܠܚ. ܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܕܠܘܩܒܠ ܐܠܗܐ ܬܗܘܘܢ ܘܠܘܩܒܠ ܥܠܡܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܒܥܘ ܡܢ ܡܪܝܐ ܕܗܟܢܐ ܬܬܪܨܘܢ ܥܝ̈ܕܝܟܘܢ. ܢܘܟܪܝܐ ܗܝ ܓܝܪ ܠܝܚ̈ܝܕܝܐ ܕܗܘܘ ܪܓܙܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܝܬ ܕܪܡܐ ܡܢ ܕܚܠܬ ܐܠܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܕܫܐܠܬܘܢ ܕܬܐܠܦܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ: ܘܐܢܐ ܠܐ ܐܗܡܝܬ ܠܡܬܠ ܡܕܡ ܕܝܠܦܬ ܡܢ ܐܒܗ̈ܬܐ̣. ܒܦܣܝ̈ܩܬܐ ܐܡ̇ܪ ܐܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܪܒܐ ܗܝ ܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܚܫܝܫܘܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܛ̈ܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Macarius
msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܫܐ ܬܠܬ ܐܢܝܢ ܕܡܟܬܪ̈ܢ. ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ̇ ܘܣܒܪܐ̣ ܘܚܘܒܐ. ܪܒܐ ܗܝ ܓܝܪ ܫܪܝܪܐܝܬ ܘܣܓܝ ܝܩܝܪܐ ܨܒܘܬܗ ܕܚܘܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Ammonius
msItem.title: The Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.note: This manuscript reckons only thirteen epistles, the rubrics of the fifth and thirteenth being omitted.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܩܕܡ ܟܠܡܕܡ ܡܨܠܐ ܐܢܐ ܥܠ ܚܘܠܡܢܟܘܢ ܕܒܕܠܐ ܡܬܚ̈ܙܝܢܝܬܐ ܐܚ̈ܝ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚ̈ܒܝܒ ܕܒܡܪܢ. ܐܢ ܐܢܫ ܡܚܒ ܠܡܪܢ ܒܟܠܗ̇ ܢܦܫܗ ܘܒܟܠܗ ܠܒܗ ܘܒܟܠܗ ܚܝܠܗ̣. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܟܬܒܬ ܠܟܘܢ ܗܕܐ ܐܓܪܬܐ̣. ܐܝܟ ܠܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܐܠܗܐ. ܘܒܥ̈ܝܘܗܝ ܒܟܘܠܗ ܠܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ..܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܝܕܥ̇ ܐܢܐ ܕܟ݁ܬܒ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܒܢ̈ܝܐ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ. ܘܠܒܢ̈ܝ ܡܘܠܟܢܐ ܘܠܒ̈ܢܝ ܡܠܟܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܕܒܡܪܢ. ܝܕܥ̇ ܐܢܐ ܕܚܘܒܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܡܥܗܕܢܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܒܐܢܫ ܕܚܒܪܗ ܐܡܝܢܐܝܬ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܒܠܠܝܐ ܘܒܐܝܡܡܐ ܡܦܝܣ ܐܢܐ ܕܚܝܠܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܢܬܝܬܪ ܒܟܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ ܕܒܡܪܢ. ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܬܐܚܫܒܘ ܒܡܢܬܐ ܕܡܠܟܘܬܐ ܕܫܡܝܐ. ܗܟܢܐ ܓܝܪ ܒܥܝܬܘܢܝܗܝ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܟܕ ܡܬܕܡܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܠܐܒ̈ܗܝܟܘܢ ܒܗ̇ ܒܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܕܒܡܪܢ ܟܬ̇ܒ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܒ̈ܢܝܐ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܐܦ ܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܓܝܪ ܦܓܪ̈ܢܝܐ ܝܬܝܪ ܡܚܒܝܢ ܠܒ̈ܢܝܗܘܢ̇. ܐܡܬܝ ܕܠܗܘܢ ܕܡ̇ܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria

msItem.incipit: ܝܕܥ ܐܢܐ ܕܒܥܠܡܐ ܕܠܒܐ ܘܢܣܝܘܢܐ ܪܒܐ ܥܠܬܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܟܬܒܬܗ̇ ܠܐܓܪܬܐ̣. ܐܬܕܟܪܬ ܡܠܬܐ ܚܕܐ ܕܐܕܝܠܬܢܝ ܕܐܟܬܘܒ ܠܟܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܢܣܝܘܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗ ܕܒܪܢܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܫܡ̇ܥ ܐܢܐ ܕܢܣܝܘܢܐ ܫܚܩ ܠܟܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܒܡܪܢ ܝܕܥܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܕܡܢ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܥܒܪ ܦܘܩܕܢܐ̣. ܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܐ ܢܦܫܐ ܕܬܕܥ ܠܐܠܗܐ̇. ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܐܪܚܩܬ ܩܢܘܡܗ̇ ܡܢ ܒ̈ܢܝ ܐܢܫܐ ܘܡܢ ܟܘܠ ܥܢ̈ܝܢܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܐ ܚܘܝܬܟܘܢ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܕܫܠܝܐ. ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܡܢ ܟܘܠܗܘܢ ܓܒ̈ܘܗܝ ܡܐܣܐ. ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܨ̇ܒܐ ܒܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܫܐܠ ܐܢܐ ܒܫܠܡܟܘܢ ܒܪܘܚܐ ܡܟܝܟܬܐ. ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܕܫܠܡܐ. ܘܝܗܒܐ ܪܝܚܐ ܒܣܝܡܐ ܒܢ̈ܦܫܬܐ ܕܙܕܝ̈ܩܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.author: Ammonius of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of the Epistles ofAmmonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܐ ܗܢܐ ܟܪܛܝܣܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܒܘܟܘܢ. ܗܕܐ ܗܝ ܝܪܬܘܬܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܙܕܝܩ̈ܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title:
The book of the
ܢܒܝܘܬܗ ܕܐܫܥܝܐ prophet Isaiah
, according to the Pěshīttā version.
msItem.note: The lessons are sometimes indicated by rubrics in the text, e.g. foll.245a,246a.

msItem.author: Basil of Caesarea
msItem.title: Extracts from the writings ofBasil

msItem.author: Basil of Caesarea
msItem.title: Letter toGregory
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ ܕܫܕܪ ܠܘܬ ܡܪܝ ܓܪܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܫܬܘܕܥܬܗ̇ ܠܐܓܪܬܟ ܒܕܡܘܬܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܫܬܘܕܥܝܢ ܠܛ̈ܠܝܐ܇ ܡܢ ܕܘܡܝܐ ܕܩܢܝܢ ܠܘܬ ܐܒܗ̈ܝܗܘܢ̇.

msItem.title: Part of Extracts from the writings ofBasil
msItem.author: Basil of Caesarea
msItem.title: Part of Extracts from the writings ofBasil
msItem.incipit: ܥܡܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܕܛܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܢܣ̇ܒ ܥܝܕܐ ܡܢ ܙܒܢܐ ܙܥܘܪܐ̣. ܕܠܐ ܐܘܠܨܢܐ ܩܝܡܝܢ ܒܗ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܩܕܡܘ ܐܬܕܪܫܘ ܒܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Index

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 5/8, consisting of 174 leaves (Add. 12,175, foll. 81—254). The quires, 17 in number, are signed with letters, originally from ܝܕto ܠ, but now from ܝـto ܟܘ. A few of the leaves are much stained and slightly torn, and the ink is occasionally so faded that some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll. 81 b and 200 a. The first quire is imperfect at the beginning. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 68 lines. This manuscript is written in a small, neat hand of the vith cent., the precise date being, apparently, A. Gr. 845, A.D. 534 (see below).

collation.p: The quires, 17 in number, are signed with letters, originally fromܝܕtoܠ, but now fromܝـtoܟܘ

item.p: A few of the leaves are much stained and slightly torn, and the ink is occasionally so faded that some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll.81band200a.

list.item: The first quire is imperfect at the beginning.
The writing on fol.254bis much effaced, in part intentionally.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 68 lines.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a small, neat hand of thevith cent., the precise date being, apparently,A. Gr. 845,A.D. 534.See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Following theindexis a note containing the date, which runs nearly as follows:

p.quote: [ܐܫـ]ـܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܒܫܢܬ [ܬܡܢـ]ـܡܐܐ ܘܐܪܒܥܝܢ ܘܚܡ̈ܫ. (؟) . . . ܐ̣ . . . ܪܝܢ. ܕܡܕܒܪܐ (؟) . . ܝ̈ܠܝܬܐ: ܒܩ̈ܕܝܫܘܗܝ (؟) ܕܪܚܡ [ܠ]ـܡܫܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܛܝܡܬܐܘܣ [ܐܦܝ]ܣـܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ [ܡـ]ܕܝܢܬܐ ܪܒܬܐ ܘܫܒ[ܝܚܬ]ܐ.

item.p: Hence it seems probable that the manuscript was writtenA. Gr. 845,A.D. 534, whenTimothy III., who died in the following year, was patriarch ofAlexandria(seeRenaudot, Hist. Patr. Alexandrin. Jacob., p. 131;Le Quien, Oriens Christ., t. ii., col. 428; and compareCureton, Corpus Ignat., p. xxix.). The remaining notes appear to contain the names of the scribe and of the person for whom, or at whose expense, the book was written; but neither can now be clearly deciphered. In the second column there is the following anathema:

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܦ̇ܓܥ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̇ ܘܫܡ̇ܥ ܠܡܠ̣ܟܗ ܕܣܛܢܐ ܘܓܢ̇ܒ ܠܗ̣. ܢܗܘܐ ܝܕ݁ܥ ܕܩܕܡ ܒܝܡ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܐܝܬ ܠܗ ܕܢܬܠ ܛܝܡ̈ܘܗܝ܀.

item.p: Underneath this are some lines of ancient Arabic writing, probably of the third cent. of the Hijra, much of which is no longer distinctly legible. The latter portion contains one of the usual anathemas:

p.quote: Whoever reads in this book, and cuts a leaf out of it….., may the curse of the Messiah…..

item.p: Observe the ancient punctuation of the kāf,instead of.
On fol. 254a stands a more modern note, of thexth or xith cent., four lines of which have been purposely erased. Judging by what remains, the book belonged at this time to oneLazarus.

quote.sic: ܐܚ̈ܝ ܐܢܫ ܚܛܝܐ ܘܣܢܝܩ ܥܠ ܪܚ̈ܡܐ ܕܥ . . . ܕܒܝܬ ܐܣܛܘܢܐ . . . ܕܣܪܘܓ . . . ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܗܢܘ ܕܥܬܝܕܝܢ . . . ܒܗܢܐ ܟܬܒܐ̣. ܕܢܒܥܘܢ ܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܡܢ ܡܪܢ ܕܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܡܪܢ ܚܘܒ̈ܘܗܝ ܘܚ̈ܛܗܘܗܝ ܣ̈ܓܐܝܐ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ . ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܥܒܕ. ܐܦ ܠܗ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܝܠܗ. ܘܐܢܬ ܡܪܝ ܠܥܙܪ ܐܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܕܝܠܗ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ ܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܠܚܛܝܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ ܡܢ ܠܥܠ ܐܝܟܢܐ ܕܠܟ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܣܐ. ܟܠ ܕܡܨܠܐ ܢܨܠܐ ܠܦܝܠܓܐ ܨܠܘܬܝ ܥܠ ܕܣܪܛ.

item.p: Some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll. 81b and 200a.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
